name: Recycled Amerciana! Road side BBQ
description:
Interstate BBQ is on the horizon! Brought to you by Detroit's finest. 
 This 1955 Ford bumper made it through years on the road just to hang it up for some old time BBQ. Constructed like we used to make them, welded riveted, built to last. This sign is good to go inside or out. It will take a punch from your rowdiest guest and would love to be the new hit at your next shake down.

 Note:
  This sign has mounting plates built in on the back side top and bottom sections W/ 5/16" holes. If you have questions on a special installation application, please drop us a line for a custom fit solution. 
 Recycled Americana.
 Free Shipping In the U.S.
  
   41" Tall
   21" Wide
   13" Deep
   34.  Lbs

name: Desert Mistchief Robot Bank
description:
I'm a mini safe for your stash or just an over sized bank for the family. My head spins 360 and my swinging mustachio will hook your guest with questions about my origins. Your stash is safe and sound with me......I promise.....
 W-13"1/2
 D-9"1/2
 T-30"
 These banks are all recycled and will get your friends talking about your spending habits.
The bank is primarily constructed from sheet metal tailings and various odds and ends harvest from our industrial evolution. A section of cold rolled perforated mesh allows you to see your money come and go. This banks durable construction ensures generations of use and abuse.
Cash out and finance that burning desire, or maybe just a little gas money till payday.
My original works are hand painted, welded and riveted with love. Each piece is signed and dated.

Voigt
Whats the story?
 I had long summers full of hot days and dusty bike rides on canal roads. We always found trouble mid day when everyone was inside and we were out playing in the irrigation ditches. Fire works from Rocky Point, peashooters and lighters. Drop a quarter in the old Spy Hunter on the way back still made it home on time. Well close.
-His chart toppin hat comes via a re-purposed fence post caps.
-Eyes & Top lights: Scrap Material sections serve as his eye details combined with vintage aviation panel light lenses make up his eyes and body lights. Found south of Tucson,AZ.
-Side Indicators: Mid 70's Aviation marker light sockets. L.A.
-Nose & Stash: Cast tow hook meets Bicycle brake calipers forged into his swanky swinging mustachio. This has a side to side swinging action.
-Body: His Body case was a electrical junction box that never made it to the show. The belt is made from Stainless Steel banding strap and the latch is harvested from a vintage toolbox. 
-Arms:VW bug push rod tubes. His hands are constructed from used bicycle bearing races. These have a great spring action upon contact.
-Rear Pack: Found metal box with Military Radio I.D. Badge.(1960s)
-Legs:(Heat reflectors) Found the curved sections were found in a gas ceiling heater from the 1960s. Mild steel tubing makes his boots and leg structure. The long tapered riveted details are arms from vintage highway safety reflectors. 
-Inside: You get 1-Vintage film canister.
                             1-Oiler
                             1-Mini May sen Jar with rivets.
                             1-Paps magnet.
                             1-Vintage 1954 Tijuana postcard.
                           Note: The Lighter and Fire Cracker are not included in this sale! Sorry. 
Put your money in a bank you can trust.
  Thanks for stopping by.
 Voigt

name: Pit Stop Love, Picture & Key holder.
description:
Shift your mood with this recycled picture holder. Made from a broken timing gear, shift knob,old reflective glass hotel letters and alligator clips that hold fast to your loved ones when your gone.
 The bottom gear is perfect for your keys or some hard candy for the road.  
 
  Tall-19"1/4
  Wide-8"5/8

name: Radio the Robot Bike Rack
description:
Radio will light up any urban commute. Made from 3X3 sq tubing his frame is built to last the public's most curious monkeys. Fully welded and ready for a color of your choice. If your into its natural state we offer a clear coat that will preserve its wonderful patina for years to come with a little annual maintenance.
 This model is just that, If you need a special sized rack we can make you a custom size to fit your needs.
 Public art that aspires to speak not to a limited gallery-going public but to the entire people, is the defining urban art of your city.
   Please drop us a line for a full description and color schemes. 
 Happy Biking!
            Voigt

name: Doug Dog
description:
Slap happy folk art dog made from old casters,training wheels and a car spring. His welded head is assembled from material bearings bicycle bearing races an old measuring square,scrap steel and topped off with a vintage trailer light lens.
Eager to be included this pup will bring smiles to your friends and family upon their arrival. Fully welded this piece will stand the test of time and curious hands. This dog could be a great learning tool for the kids or just that funky accent piece that nobody else has.
Please message me if you have any request . I make special sizes, breeds ,expressions, period pieces and personal detail pieces.
Thanks for checking in..
Voigt

name: Salvador doggie.
description:
Salv is every spastic dog you've ever encountered minus the scratching and yelping. Frozen in that introductory state he will draw your guest in for a kinetic touch of his glorious mustache. Small enough for your large bag he travels well and loves photo ops all over your social outlets.
Made from Training wheels, Roller Skate wheels, Bicycle parts, a Metal Square, Aviation panel light lenses, Recycled steel and love.
 This guy has great rolling action along with spring reaction to your guest attention. Welded together with expertise this dog's will life will make it  through your family's wildest endeavors.
 Please message me if you have any request . I make special sizes, breeds ,expressions, period pieces and personal detail pieces
Thanks for checking in..
Voigt

12"-Tall
8"-Wide
14-Long

name: Jerry The Flashing light Robot Bank
description:
This Robot penny bank loves sticky tires, loud pipes and cash.
A 9- Volt battery powers his Red  L.E.D eyes through vintage panel light lenses along with favorite motor badge makes up his fashionable exterior.
His flashing eyes are controlled by a knife toggle switch and is wired to a modern circuit for days of visual action. This system also allows you to set the speed and pattern of his isolating lights with a simple eye glass screw driver. Its kinds fun to set his mood to your space.
 His Gauge cant hide the joy he brings to the table. Dating back to the 50's it will keep your friends dreaming about its origin. A plastic plug underneath allows the money to flow when the time is right.
My original works are hand painted, welded and riveted with love. Each piece is hand signed and dated for authenticity.
Put your money in a bank you can trust. Save green with Earnest.

Voigt
-13" Tall
-6"1/2 Wide
-5"1/2 Deep

name: Tom's roasted peanuts Robot
description:
Meet Tom, he's your best friend for a snack or keeping the ranch company. At 7'8" this gentle giant will set the tone for your space and keep your guests talking for years to come. 
 Tom started out a retail man delivering salty peanuts to the working class southerners.  After years of moving around I found him sitting on a porch in Central Texas. Next thing I know Tom was in the truck and headed for Arizona. Back at the Studio parts started to migrate towards his corner of the yard. After 6 months Tom's inventory was ready for trimming and a little polishing. Many long days of fabrication Tom filled up the work space with presence  and daily visitors from our local school bus stop.  He made the trip and is alive for his next chapter....Are you in it?

 Tom's Cabinet is currently  empty and waiting for its next owners needs. Build out is available and Tom will break down  and fit in the darnedest places with one single wrench. Please feel free to drop us a line if we can answer any questions for you!
  Voigt

name: Mantel sculpture, Trooper Robot
description:
"The galaxy is in your hands Robot Trooper, roam the terrain and protect the innocent!"
 This Trooper's head and bust are made from recycled steel and a vintage  junction box. His mouth detail was found in a interior door panel from a 1969 Oldsmobile 89. The same car donated a  road safety kit that was turned into communication antennas. His Aviation lights are not operational however, flashing lite options are available for an additional $60.00. This comes with an old school knife switch to start the action. Be sure to select upon check out. 
 My original works are hand painted, welded and riveted with love. Each piece is hand signed and dated for authenticity.

name: Lady PamPunch the Robot bank
description:
Pam's a sassy Robot from the valley. She tells it like it is and doesn't  hold back. Her magnetic eye brows allows you to adjust her mood on the fly.This domestic goddess loves cash and a juicy gossip. Just see what the neighbors say when she moves in.
 Her body is constructed from a section of square tubing along with some sink drain screens that are now acting as her curious ears. Vintage bakelite knobs, aviation panel light lenses and a old porcelain insulator make up her Sunday best.  Her front detail and gauge were found on a trip to Los Alomos, New Mexico's famous "Black Hole." The Black Hole as recently closed its doors and these parts are some of the last to leave. 
 Her Aviation lights are not operational however, flashing lite options are available for an additional $60.00. This comes with an old school knife switch to start the action. Be sure to select upon check out.
My original works are hand painted, welded and riveted with love. Each piece is hand signed and dated for authenticity. This banks construction ensures generations of use.  Save green with Lady PamPunch.
 12"1/2 Tall
 4"1/2 Wide
 4"1/2 Deep
